comment: His class was entertaining but sometimes confusing. Everyone looked at him funny when he explained we would be doing a Literature review paper with a partner- which seems unnecessary but went better than I thought. He always kept the class laughing though. Very nice but was strict on his policies.

While Mr. Kim seems like a really nice guy, I don't think I could have taken a worse professor for COM 3435. The papers are absolutely horrible, at least 15 pages each, and he's very unclear about what he wants from the assignments. He's also got a very thick accent, which he knows, and if you just pay attention, it's not too hard to understand him
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: While he seems like a nice guy, he's not very clear about what he expects from assignments, and he's not very direct when he answers questions. He also has a thick accent, so if you think that might impair you, you might want to pick a different teacher.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Kim is a hilarious! He's very knowledgable, but sometimes his accent is hard to understand. You definitely have to work hard in this class. 4 tests, 2 HUGE papers, and 1 group presentation.  Uses trick questions on tests so make sure you know the content. First paper is the hardest, has to be at least 15 pages. Would still take again!

RUN FOR THE HILLS!! Dr. Kim is honestly the worst professor I've ever had. He is extremely unclear, expects you to teach yourself things, he is rude, interrupts students, etc. If you can take someone else for your class, do it.

dr. kim is hilarious. and really nice. attendance is mandatory. here's your grade: 2 big papers (done with group members or alone. it's up to you), 4 tests, a presentation, and participation. the first paper is tough. the second one is much easier. there's no HW. AND DON'T BUY THE BOOK; IT WAS A TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY. i'd love to take kim again.

This guy's awesome. The course is quite a bit of work, but I really enjoyed class time with him. His tests are mostly easy, seeing as they go over the same concepts. Very funny smart guy. If you like to participate in class, and like a teacher that can light up a classroom, take him. Heeman is life.

I had him last semester and I am not exaggerating when I say DO NOT take this class with him.  Take 3435 with anyone else but avoid him at all costs; you won't be sorry you did.  His class is confusing and I understand the concepts are hard but he provides no clarity whatsoever.

Very easy. Do the work, turn it on time, and get to know him. He's a nice guy, but you earn your grade. If you get a C or lower, chances are you were rude in class, skipped frequently, or can't turn in your projects.

Don't take this teacher. Will never answer a question in a straight forward manner. Absolutely no electronics (take your notes by hand), thick accent very hard to understand, does not have high regard for women or minorities. All tests are cumulative.

His accent doesn't cause any problems, everything on the test is on the powerpoints which are posted, and as long as you set deadlines for yourself the paper is fine. The worst part of his class were the other people in it. If you have a good attitude and listen to lectures like you're supposed to be doing then it's an easy A
worst instructor I have EVER taken. shows favoritism and REFUSES to help on clarifying  assignments when they are allowed to be submitted for revision. DO NOT TAKE!!!!!

Great professor. Has a Korean accent but I was able to easily understand him. 2 exams, one 8-10 pg.research paper, & one 5-6 pg. cultural report & presentation. I took a hybrid so there was 1 weekly discussion post.Exams are not easy because there are only two, & each includes 6 chapters. HEAVY focus on the research paper.Nice & EXTREMELY helpful

I really thought that the language barrier was not going to be a problem, but I could barely understand him. VERY thick accent which is ironic since he teaches COM. I would NEVER take him again. But yes he is nice. But being nice doesn't help my GPA.

Dr. Kim knows what he is talking about in class, however it may require more effort on your part to understand what he is saying.   Sometimes he has to clarify things again, however he does so enthusiastically.  He may give you a difficult work load, but he is willing to help you.  Also, his tests are not too bad since he recycles old questions.
Dr. Kim always wants to make sure we are doing our project correctly.
I really enjoy his classes.
Dr. Kim is Great.
He is one of great professors at Kennesaw. He is very knowledgible about the subject.

THIS CLASS IS HARD! ALL GROUP WORK: 2 BIG PAPERS AND 4 TESTS. He is so funny and a very nice guy. I ended up with a B in the class and I worked my butt off. The material is awful but he is a jokster and will put a smile on your face, despite the hard work. Take him if your not lazy.

If you like using your laptop in class, dont take him. He will not let you. Also, your papers must be by his format. down to the paragraph and how many words are to be in a sentence. I got a B but it was tough with the paper.His test are very easy, he just keeps adding questions to the 1st test. 25 then 30 then like 40 for the final. Easy tests!

At first you have to get used to his accent, but he is totally open to repeating things or clarifying them.  He has a great sense of humor, is willing to talk to students any time, and is very knowledgeable in his subject matter.  I thought he graded extremely fairly and expected nothing more than should be expected from upper level students.

He knows his stuff, but he doesn't really know how to teach it.  The language barrier is a blatant problem, more so than just a little "hard to understand at times."  I would recommend taking a different person for this class.  Very strict attendance policy.  Makes you ask before leaving the room to go to the restroom.
